However, recently they have become even more hostile and dangerous than usual. Something dark has always been hidden beneath the crests of the sand. Now, it has awakened again. The giant insects swarm over the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj to bear witness to the awakening of their dark master.
column4: Die dunklen Dünen von Silithus waren noch nie ein sicherer Ort. Der trockene Wind der toten Wüste, lästige Insekten, die einen manchmal einfach unter den Boden ziehen oder in die Luft heben können. In letzter Zeit sind sie jedoch noch feindseliger und gefährlicher geworden als sonst. Etwas Dunkles war schon immer unter den Dünen des Sandes verborgen. Jetzt ist es wieder erwacht. Die gigantischen Insekten schwärmen über die Ruinen von Ahn'Qiraj, um dem Erwachen ihres dunklen Meisters beizuwohnen.

column2: The Qiraji will devour them all!
column4: Die Qiraji werden sie alle vertilgen!

column2: The ancient evil must remain in confinement!
column4: Das uralte Böse muss eingesperrt bleiben!
Verbrennt das Böse

column2: Burn all unholy characters as evil beings or get a reason to execute them if they're rulers. They deserve to die!
column4: Verbrennt alle unheiligen Wesen. Sie verdienen nur den Tod!
§Y[This.GetBestName]§! wird zum Tod durch Verbrennung verurteilt.

column2: Physical class level is 1 or higher\n
column4: Phyische Klassenstufe beträgt 1 oder höher\n

column2: Physical class level is 3 or higher\n
column4: Phyische Klassenstufe beträgt 3 oder höher\n

column2: Physical class level is 5 or higher\n
column4: Phyische Klassenstufe beträgt 5 oder höher\n

column2: Physical class level is 7 or higher\n
column4: Phyische Klassenstufe beträgt 7 oder höher\n
Phyische Klassenstufe beträgt 9 oder 10\n

column2: You fought in the heat of battle alongside your soldiers. When the first unfortunate enemy soldier died by your hand, his blood splashed onto your tunic. You quickly rushed to the next opponent with a deafening cry!
column4: Ihr habt in der Hitze der Schlacht mit Euren Soldaten gekämpft. Als der erste unglückselige feindliche Soldat durch Eure Hand starb, spritzte sein Blut auf Euren Waffenrock. Ihr seid mit einem ohrenbetäubenden Schrei blitzschnell auf den nächsten Gegner zu gestürmt!
Vorwärts!
Beschwört Essen

column2: Use your magic to conjure food to improve the opinions of others about you.
column4: Nutzt Eure Magie um Essen zu beschwören und dadurch die Meinung anderer über Euch zu verbessern.

column2: Your magic can work wonders. Creating food and wine literally from thin air, you are able to surprise any audience: from the richest aristocrats to the homeless poor. However, your tricks are not enough for us all, so a choice must be made.
column4: Eure Magie kann Wunder wirken. Wenn Ihr Speisen und Wein buchstäblich aus dem Nichts erschafft, könnt Ihr jedes Publikum überraschen: von den reichsten Aristokraten bis hin zu den heimatlosen Armen. Eure Kunststücke reichen jedoch nicht für alle aus, also muss eine Entscheidung getroffen werden.
Für die Armen.
Für die Reichen.
Ach, egal...
Beschwört Essen für die Armen
Beschwört Essen für die Reichen

column2: As a true connoisseur of magic, you often spend many hours researching the secrets of the universe. And so, you again decided to devote a couple of months of your life to exploring the secrets of arcane magic.
column4: Als wahrer Kenner der Magie verbringt Ihr oft viele Stunden damit, die Geheimnisse des Universums zu erforschen. Und so habt Ihr Euch wieder entschieden, ein paar Monate Eures Lebens der Erforschung der Geheimnisse der arkanen Magie zu widmen.
Lasst uns loslegen!
Nein, heute nicht.

column2: While doing your research, you felt a clear lack of knowledge. Many ancient volumes have already turned into dust or got lost from the shelves of your library. To continue your work, you must purchase new books.
column4: Während Ihr Euren Forschungen nachgeht, habt Ihr einen deutlichen Mangel an Wissen verspürt. Viele alte Schriften sind bereits zu Staub zerfallen oder aus den Regalen Eurer Bibliothek verschwunden. Um Eure Arbeit fortzusetzen, müsst Ihr neue Bücher kaufen.
Sendet Boten aus.

column2: No, it's a waste of money!
column4: Nein, das ist reine Geldverschwendung!

column2: For several nights, sitting and studying the arcane without a break, you let out a yawn. Even a magician like yourself needs rest, because no magic can protect you from the lack of sleep and fatigue. A few hours of sleep wouldn't hurt.
column4: Für mehrere Nächte sitzt Ihr in Eurer Bibliothek und brütet über den Büchern und Schriften. Selbst ein Magier wie Ihr braucht etwas Ruhe, denn keine Magie kann Euch vor Schlafmangel und Müdigkeit schützen. Ein paar Stunden Schlaf könnten nicht schaden.
Ich muss meine Forschungen fortsetzen!
Ich mache ein Nickerchen.

column2: In your magical research, you sometimes resorted to testing in practice. There were signs of trouble. You tried to test another safe spell, but something went wrong. A flash, an outburst of fire... and suddenly you found yourself on the verge of life and death.
column4: Bei Euren magischen Forschungen habt Ihr manchmal auf Experimente in der Praxis zurückgegriffen. Dabei gab es Anzeichen von Schwierigkeiten. Ihr habt versucht, einen weiteren sicheren Zauber zu testen, aber etwas ist schief gelaufen. Ein Blitz, ein Feuerausbruch... und plötzlich standet Ihr am Rande von Leben und Tod.

column2: At the end of your long search, you feel that you are at an impasse. You re-read many volumes of various books, but could not find anything of interest at all. You may have been looking in the wrong places, but you might not have been looking over here! Now it is not so important anymore...
column4: Am Ende Eurer langen Suche spürt Ihr, dass Ihr Euch in einer Sackgasse befindet. Ihr habt viele Bände verschiedener Bücher wieder und wieder durchgelesen, konntet aber nichts Interessantes finden. Vielleicht habt Ihr an den falschen Stellen gesucht! Jetzt ist es nicht mehr so wichtig...

column2: After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In the ancient books, you discovered the skill of creating short-term portals over long distances. Unfortunately, living beings will not survive this journey, but through these portals you could transport cargo.
column4: Nach Euren langen Recherchen spürt ihr endlich, dass Ihr an der Schwelle zu neuen Entdeckungen steht. In den alten Büchern habt Ihr die Kunst entdeckt, kurzfristige Portale über weite Strecken zu erschaffen. Leider werden Lebewesen diese Reise nicht überleben, aber durch diese Portale könnte man Fracht transportieren.

column2: After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you discovered the secret mastery of telekinesis, which allows you to lift heavy objects into the air. It could significantly speed up and reduce the cost of the construction process in your domain.
column4: Nach Euren langen Recherchen spürt Ihr endlich, dass Ihr an der Schwelle zu neuen Entdeckungen steht. In alten Büchern habt Ihr die geheime Beherrschung der Telekinese entdeckt, mit der Ihr schwere Gegenstände in die Luft heben könnt. Es könnte die Baukosten in Eurem Reich erheblich reduzieren und die Konstruktion beschleunigen.

column2: After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshhold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you discovered the mastery of mass creation of dishes and wines from pure magical energy. With this opportunity, you have a chance to feed all the hungry in your realm. For years to come, your people will not know of hunger!
column4: Nach Euren langen Recherche habt Ihr endlich das Gefühl, dass Ihr an der Schwelle zu neuen Entdeckungen steht. In alten Büchern habt lhr die Kunst der Massenschöpfung von Gerichten und Weinen aus reiner magischer Energie entdeckt. Mit dieser Möglichkeit habt Ihr die Gelegenheit, alle Hungrigen in Eurem Reich zu ernähren. Für die kommenden Jahre wird Euer Volk nicht von Hunger heimgesucht werden!
Magische Geheimnisse: Teleportation
Magische Geheimnisse: Telekinese
Magische Geheimnisse: Essensbeschwörung

column2: After your long research, you finally feel that you are at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you discovered the knowledge of resurrecting the dead. Even if the creature was already dead, you can return its soul to this world. You can continue your search, but if you cross this line, then there is no way back.

After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you found information about the powerful energy of the Fel. It is a dark force that feeds on the life force of the living and gives the demons their power. You can continue your research, but if you cross this line, there will be no turning back.

After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you found information about... the Old Gods and the twisted magic of the Void. Not many were able to curb this force and remain sane. You can continue your research, but if you cross this line, there will be no turning back.
Devote a couple of months of your life to studying the secrets of arcane magic that can give you a benefitial modifier.

After many years of peace and quiet, the rumors of ''death cults'' began to circulate in the northern provinces. The cults attracted the disenfranchised and disheartened citizens of Lordaeron, offering them ''eternal life'' on Azeroth as an alternative to the servitude to the king. King Terenas knew that troubles were only just beginning for his land. He took some comfort in the fact that Lordaeron had endured every trial that had ever come its way – and that its defenders, both new and old, would see it safely through to a new dawn…
column3: Après des années de paix et de tranquillité, des rumeurs d’un certains nombres de supposés “cultes de la Mort se formant” commencèrent à circuler dans les provinces du nord. Ce culte séduisit les laissés pour compte de Lordaeron en leur offrant une vie éternelle, plutôt qu’une courte vie sous l’hégémonie du roi. Le roi Terenas II sut pertinemment que les problèmes ne faisaient que commencer pour son pays, mais lui et son peuple furent confiants dans le fait qu’autrefois ils purent vaincre toutes les épreuves qu’ils purent subir, ainsi que dans le fait que ses défenseurs, anciens et nouveaux, les verraient traverser ce nouvel âge sans encombre...

column2: You received news that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], under the influence of the Fel, abandoned [Root.GetHisHer] own body in favour of an immortal existence on the edge of the physical world and the demonic Twisting Nether.
You received news that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] fell under the influence of dark forces, which strive to plunge Azeroth into the abyss of chaos and suffering

The Scythe of Elune is a mystical artifact created from Goldrinn's fang and the Staff of Elune. It is described as an ancient weapon - a twisted and gnarled branch of wood covered with runes, which could be even older than the Kaldorei. Those who are not careful enough, could easily be overwhelmed by Goldrinn's spirit, which infuses the scythe. Tied to the origin of the worgen on Azeroth, the scythe is said to possess untold lunar power for the druid with balance enough to keep control.

As one of the titanic watchers, keeper Tyr bore this weapon in countless battles against the titans' enemies. When one of his fellow keepers, Loken, fell to corruption, Tyr and his allies stole the Discs of Norgannon to investigate the extent of Loken's betrayal. Discovering the theft, Loken sent horrific monsters after Tyr's group, but Tyr sacrificed his life to fight the creatures while his comrades escaped with the discs.
This mysterious staff is the source of great magic. Although Aluneth's origin is unknown, the civilization that created it, had a very deep knowledge of arcane magic.

Vampiric demons known as nathrezim forged this ancient sword, which brings with it violence, plagues, and death. Apocalypse soon earned a horrific reputation in the hands of a Tirisgarde mage who couldn't control its destructive energies.

Before the eredar served the titan Sargeras, one of their greatest leaders, Thal'kiel, had unprecedented skill with summoning and binding magics. Driven by ambition, he reached into the Void and was answered with knowledge of dark creatures unlike any the eredar had seen before. Thal'kiel's apprentice, Archimonde, discovered his master's dark pact and revealed it to Thal'kiel's fellow rulers, who banded together to strike Thal'kiel down. After his defeat, they had his skull gilded and placed on display as a warning.

Atiesh, the greatstaff of the Guardian is a powerful staff passed down through the line of the Guardians of Tirisfal. The staff was born from the ''seed of hate'' and grants its wielder ''unending power''. It was passed down by each Guardian of Tirisfal to its successor.
With this top hat, you will definitely attract attention to yourself!
Use poisonous gas against §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! to make [Root.GetHerHim] incapable for a while.

While you were in your chambers, you noticed that a strange figure slipped into the doorway behind your back. A moment later, the whole room was filled with green gas. You rushed out of there, covering your face with your hand.

At midnight your assassin made it into [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber with a sealed container of deadly gas. The container was put down next to one of the beds and the assassin broke its seal before swiftly slipping out through the door, closing it silently behind him as the gas seeped out from the container. Nobody saw or heard anything of your assassin, who quickly escaped out of the castle. The mission was a success!

In the middle of the night your assassin made his way to [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber with a sealed container of deadly gas. Your assassin, however, managed to damage it while climbing up over the castle walls. He soon felt weak and fell to the cold floor where he choked on the gas, which seeped from the container... Your assassin was found dead by guards on patrol in the early morning.

In the middle of the night your assassin made his way to [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber with sealed containers of gas. He placed one at the bedside and broke its seal before making a hasty retreat through the door as the gas seeped from the container. With the few extra containers he had, he thought it would please you, if he set them in the other nearby rooms to ensure [From.GetFirstName] perished to the poisonous gas.
Has not been target of this decision in the last 3 years.\n
Forget about the peaceful life and change your government type to an Undead Horde with advanced CBs.
Forget about the peaceful life and change your government type to a Demonic Legion with advanced CBs.
Forget about the peaceful life and change your government type to a Black Pact, a loyal pawn of the Old Gods with advanced CBs.

Adopting Tribal Monarchy will convert all your tribal holdings into castles. When this occurs - if the county is big enough - city and temple holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your vassals are likely to follow if they are of your religion and culture.

Most recently you have hatched from an egg, surrounded by the yapping of the other hatchlings of your dragonflight. You are still tiny, but dragons can grow up to colossal sizes. Perhaps, one day you may become the largest creature of your kind.

Much time has passed since you hatched from the egg. Though now you can fly over the endless fields and forests of Azeroth and your form appears to be that of an adult dragon, but your kindred still disdain you.

Not the first decade is under your belt, not many relatives can surpass you in wingspan and strength. Your size and graceful form instills fear and magnificence in the hearts of enemies and allies alike.

The kingdoms of the mortals were created and destroyed right in front of your eyes. The land is shaking under your paws. A flap of your wings can crook trees in several miles around you. Your enemies make a hasty retreat once your shadow covers them.

[From.GetTitledName], one of your neighbours is engaged in the bloody war against the forces of evil. Many encourage you to forget about all your disputes and quarrels and join the war immediately. If [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName] falls, you will be next.

You are dead, but you still have to worry about your heir, who will take your place if the dark magic can no longer bring you back into this world. [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] has become even more loyal after [From.GetHerHis] death. Among all the other dead, [target_new_member.GetSheHe] is the best candidate.

Though your soul is formally immortal, you still need to worry about your heirs, who will continue your work if you do not return from the Twisting Nether. [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] would be the perfect candidate to lead your legions in the future.

The world is a dangerous place and accidents can happen, perhaps you could break down in combat or for other reasons, but there is a remedy to secure your legacy. [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] is a simple construct, but if you shared part of your life spark with him he could carry on your legacy should something happen to you.

Among all other creatures of the Void, there is one which has deserved your trust. Mortals call it [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName]. When you will return to the darkness again, it will be able to take your place.

[target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] is the most loyal to your court. You cannot remember a single case where [target_new_member.GetSheHe] has let you down. Perhaps one day [target_new_member.GetSheHe] will be able to continue your work...
The magic of [From.GetEluneLight] makes living creatures stronger, but brings incredible pain to dark creatures.
You feel how [target_priest.GetLightType] is shooting through your veins with every beat of the heart, strengthening your body and spirit.

[target_priest.GetTitledFirstName] has granted you the blessing of [target_priest.GetEluneLight]. You feel how [target_priest.GetLightType] is pulsating through your veins with every beat of the heart, strengthening your body and spirit.
Damned [FromFrom.GetFirstName] has cursed your body with the Light. Streams of the holy energy penetrate you like stakes, tearing you from the inside and bringing an unbearable pain.
This character has received the blessing of the Light.
column3: Ce personnage a reçu la bénédiction de la Lumière.

column2: This character has received the mark of Light. The magic of the Light brings incredible pain to dark creatures.
Use Void magic to drive this character mad.
[target_crazy.GetTitledFirstName] could not resist the power of the Void. Like many others, [target_crazy.GetSheHe] fell into a spiral of dark thoughts inspired by you.
Not many can resist the dark magic of the Void. Despite all of your efforts, [target_crazy.GetTitledFirstName] found the strength to ward off all the dark thoughts.

You wanted to turn the Void against your enemies, but it spares no one. Darkness has crept into your mind and turned your thoughts inside out. The last scraps of your mind slowly leave you, while you sink deeper and deeper into the abyss of madness.

You do not understand what is happening to you. Every time you are alone, you see previous events of your life, all of them differing from each other. The regrets of your past torment you, while the voice in your head whispers terrifying prophecies.
Do wicked things! Curse [From.GetHerHim] with diseases and nightmares!

Only stars in the sky witnessed your dark voodoo. All night long you were tirelessly dancing a ritual dance. Thousands of phantom eyes were watching your ecstatic dance. Since the evil spirits are on your side now, it's time to bring their anger down on your enemies.

You constantly feel someone's presence next to you. As if hundreds of spirits were flying around you, circling, laughing like madmen. It seems like you are slowly going crazy, maybe because of some sort of dark magic. Their laughter in your mind won't leave you, not for a second, turning your life into pure madness.

Weakness has intertwined into your mind and body. You constantly hear echoes of the mad spirits laughter. They are giggling at what you've been turned into. There is no doubt that your troubles were caused by the dark magic of your foes.
Your body and spirit are growing stronger with every passing day. On your fingertips you feel the power floating in the air. Hundreds of phantom eyes are watching over you.
Time is passing, but your dark voodoo doesn't seem to work. [target_doll.GetFirstName] even didn't feel your magic. Perhaps the spirits understood you wrong.

Time is passing, but your dark voodoo doesn't seem to work. [target_doll.GetFirstName] became even stronger and wiser than [From.GetSheHeCap] was before. It seems to you that the spirits even protect [target_doll.GetHerHim]. Perhaps they understood you totally wrong.
Use arcane magic to sharpen the mind of this character.

The arcane magic has a surprising effect on your mind. All thoughts and memories were organised and collected in an immense library deep in your mind. Planning and the process of thinking were never so simple for you.

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] used a secret spell on you. It has a surprising affect on your mind. All thoughts and memories were organised and collected in an immense library deep in your mind. Planning and the process of thinking were never so simple to you.
Arcane Magic has sharpened the mind of this character.
Subdue a n'raqi, a terrifying creature from the Void. Be careful, this decision can turn into a disaster if you're not a servant of the Old Gods.

When the rift into the Twisting Nether was opened, you saw the silhouette of a huge creature on the other side. Its thoughts were filled only with darkness, but you were able to subdue the creature. The horrifying mass of slimy flesh stepped into your dimension and bowed its head before you.

When the rift into the Twisting Nether was opened, you saw the silhouette of a huge creature on the other side. Its tentacles reached to you. With a slight sweep they broke your limbs and pulled what's left of your body into the portal. When it had closed, you found yourself alone with the creature in total darkness.
A dropout tried to get a good education, but didn't perfectly master any knowledge.
This person got a decent education. [From.GetSheHeCap] doesn't need more.
A learned person got a splendid education. [From.GetSheHeCap] is able to shine with [From.GetHerHis] mind.
This character possesses an outstanding mind with knowledge in many different areas of life.
Lust consumes this character. This might lead to problems in [From.GetHerHis] marital life.
This character is chaste. Chaste people are admired at all times and are unlikely to have extramarital affairs.
This character has a remarkable appetite, which often leads to excess weight.
This person sticks to moderation. This is a valuable feature for rulers and vassals.
This person is known for [From.GetHerHis] greed, which, although not encouraged, allows [From.GetHerHim] to squeeze out additional tax revenues.
This character is known for [From.GetHerHis] generosity. This is perhaps the most chivalrous feature.
This character is amazingly lazy. Nobody likes lazy people.
This character is diligent and executive and is known among the people for [From.GetHerHis] astounding zeal.
This character is known for [From.GetHerHis] envious behaviour, which covers insincerity and malice.
This character is kind and full of empathy. Kind character may be popular with vassals, but this trait makes them poor spymasters.
This character certainly has a hot temper. Sometimes it can fall on others.
This character is ready to wait as long as necessary. Patient characters are just a little bit better at almost everything.
For some reason this character is proud or even selfish. Proud characters tend to be ambitious and work hard to gain prestige.

This character is humble and [From.GetHerHis] trait is expressed in moderation in [From.GetHerHis] demands, indifference to wealth and luxury, as well as [From.GetHerHis] determination to show [From.GetHerHis]self. Humble people tend to dislike proud ones.
Don't forget to report bugs! Unreported bugs can't be fixed!
If your children's mentors have levels in any class, they can teach your children the ways of sword and magic.
Lead the war very carefully, otherwise the whole world could take up arms against you.
Don't forget to periodically check your possible decisions. There you can find many unique features that will not always be available to you.
Joining a political faction is a very good way to find new allies for a very long time.
Watch out for dark cult activity in your realm. If they get the chance to spread, you may lose your only chance to stop them.
If you decide to study the dark arts, you shouldn't forget that you're walking along the edge of the abyss.
If your class level is low, you can ask other characters with a higher level in the same class to mentor you personally by right-clicking their portraits.
The dark gods can be very eloquent and convincing, but you are just a pawn in their big game.
A warlord and the leader of the Arathi tribe. He led them to unify the human tribes into the nation of Arathor and forged an alliance with the high elves during the Troll Wars.
Lord of the Forest and patron of many druids, is one of the most powerful and influential demigods of Azeroth. Worshipped by the night elves since their early history.
The capital city is a heart of your kingdom. You have to take control of it.

The forging of your runeblade is now complete. This weapon has become a deadly extension of your very being, and with the runes of frost, unholy, and blood etched into your new blade, your power as a death knight has significantly increased.
You are no longer able to continue training because of your health problems.
with a single spell crushs my [This.GetBodyPartInjured]
cast a magic bolt right into [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetBodyPartInjured], singeing it
casts a magic bolt right into my [Root.GetBodyPartInjured], singeing it
throw an arrow of magic energy into the side of [other_combatant.GetHerHis] head
throws an arrow of magic energy into the side of my head
throw an arrow of magic energy into [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetBodyPartInjured]
throws an arrow of magic energy into my [Root.GetBodyPartInjured]
cause a magic blast right beside [other_combatant.GetHerHis] [other_combatant.GetBodyPartInjured]
causes a magic blast right beside my [Root.GetBodyPartInjured]
with one perfect spell blast [This.GetHerHis] head

throw a magic bolt into [other_combatant.GetHerHis] chest. [other_combatant.GetFirstName] falls, [other_combatant.GetHerHis] entrails spilling out on the ground. [other_combatant.GetSheHeCap] does not rise again
throws a magic bolt – it hits my chest and I fall to the ground, trying to keep my own entrails from spilling out. There is so much... Pain
and threw an arrow of magic energy that hit [other_combatant.GetHerHim] directly
Only evil characters can be nominated. Vassals will not approve if their liege personally holds too many elector titles.

Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portraits of your prisoners in order to turn them into the monstrous undead and your loyal servants, in exchange for §Yuseful flesh§!, §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§! or for §Ymana§!, if you’re a necromancer or a death knight.
§RCan not declare wars§! before C'thun's Awakening (it happens 25 years after Dark Portal)
If §YMind Power§! is low, can §Rlose undead servants§!
Serves Legion, Old Gods or Lich King\n
Has unpleasant trait (deceitful, shy, paranoid, cruel, stubborn, haughty, brooding, impaler, greedy, wroth, envious etc.)\n
A well crated mockery of the legendary spear of the Bloodhoof clan.

The Frostwolf Clan, ruled the by honourable orc [Root.GetTitledFirstName] have found their new home in [Root.Capital.GetName]. They have chosen independence from the Horde, and seek to secure the future of their clan by creating a new homeland for their tribe. This has led some clans to label the Frostwolves as traitors, though the Frostwolves counter that those clans in the Horde are traitors to their old ideals and traditions. It remains to be seen just how this new development will impact the other clans. Maybe more will choose tradition over unity?
Rats! The Horde will hunt them all!

Durotan, son of Garad and father of Go'el, was the chieftain of the Frostwolf Clan. Relations between the Frostwolf and the Blackrock clans were icy, even before the invasion of Azeroth, due to the Frostwolves refusing to accept the demonic bargain and drink the blood of Mannoroth. When the Horde crossed over into Azeroth, Durotan continued to voice opposition regarding the Horde's leadership, which caused Gul'dan to exile the Frostwolf Clan.
column3: Durotan, fils de Garad et père de Go'el, fut le chef du Clan Loup-de-givre. Même avant l'invasion d'Azeroth, et en raison de son refus lui et son peuple d'accepter le marché démoniaque en buvant le sang de Mannoroth, les relations entre les clans Loup-de-givre et Rochenoire furent glaciales. Lorsque la Horde arriva sur Azeroth, Durotan continua de s'élever et de protester contre sa direction, ce qui obliga Gul'dan à l'exiler lui et tout son clan.

column2: The Horde has arrived on Azeroth, and is preparing for its offensive under the guidance of [From.GetBestName]. We only have a couple days before it begins, so we must hurry! Where do we go?
What a waste of time! None of the other clans chose to ally with us. We cannot wait any longer trying to convince these fools. We must leave, but where do we go?
Our home has always been to the north.

column3: Nous devons nous rendre au sud.

column2: Perhaps, the road is going to be challenging, but we can establish our home far from the threat.
The Long Road to the North
column3: La longue route vers le nord

column2: With this new beginning, we have chosen ideals and tradition over unity and bloodshed. It is the first step down a road to an uncertain future, one that may bring glory, prosperity, and security, or maybe death and suffering. Regardless of what lies ahead, you are certain that this is a road that must be travelled, for what lies behind you is a fate that your people cannot bear.\n\nHeading north, we have found an inhospitable land of snow and mountains. This will not do. [root.GetTitledFirstName], where do we go from here?
Along our travels we found a land with strange, small locals. Some were accommodating, but most were terrified of us!
Wait... are there more of them on the road?
It'll be good to get away from them.
More of the small, stocky locals were further down the road. However, these ones are armed, angry, and shouting gibberish at us. They attack!
We win. What was this all about?
We managed to beat the patrol! They fought well, especially for an enemy so small. But they are no match to members of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] clan!
Even though we fought with honour, the enemy defeated us and we had to retreat.
After a couple months of wandering, we have finally arrived at our new home, a patch of shoreline next to Ironforge. To a new beginning!
Far to the north, we have found a mountainous land, with many animals and only a few humans there to trap them. Perhaps this is a good place to make our home.

We've arrived at a sparsely-populated valley. It's far from ideal, since the land seems to be better suited for farming - not something we do as Frostwolves. Still, there are some animals to hunt, and the challenge of hunting sparser game will help strengthen us.

You continue on, journeying through the mountains until they drop almost directly into the sea. This may not be a good place to settle, but you realize you have two choices. Should we consider going back and settle in the mountain valley, or look for a way over the water, [Root.GetTitle]?
You look for a way across the sea.
You head south and settle in the Alterac Valley
After scouting the coastline, we have found a small, poorly-protected port with lots of merchant ships docked in it. Commandeering the ships would be very easy.
A messenger arrived with dire news. A small trading port in northern Lordaeron was raided, and the ships stolen by bandits! Worse yet, no one seems to know exactly who the bandits were.
Those damn murlocs must be getting smarter...
My [Root.GetTitle]! We managed to steal the ships without loss among our clan! Now we can sail north, putting both land and water between us and the Horde!

While out on the sea, we ended up sailing directly into a horrible storm. Many of our tribesmen died, and more yet are missing. You decide to turn and sail away from it, taking what's left of the Frostwolves and returning south. However, the current carries you far to the west of where you were, to a chain of islands known as the Dragon Isles. You make the hard decision to settle here, wondering if there was better land for you beyond the sea.
After that we can capture the local castle...
My [Root.GetTitle]! Land, on the horizon!\nWe ground our boats on a new land, full of giants and animals, untouched by and maybe even unknown to the civilized races of Azeroth. We should settle here!
My [Root.GetTitle], our clan is ready to leave. We've harnessed the wolves, collected our belongings, the women have dressed the children and the men have sharpened their axes. Is it time to go?
This may have been a mistake. With every step, the weather seems to get hotter, the animals larger and nastier, and the plants stranger. It must get better at some point, right?
No one ever said this would be easy!

It's hard to hunt on an empty stomach, especially with the wildlife here being so vicious and aggressive. Even the plants and berries seem to fight back, their poisons sapping the strength from us, making us throw up the little food we manage to find. There are several options for us, none of which seem easy...
We try to ignore the hunger. Starvation sets in, making our men weak, our women frail, and our children howling with need. We can't keep going like this!
At least we are not dead...

Alchemy and herbalism are not Frostwolf traditions, but desperate times call for desperate measures. We have sent some of our men and women to search for edible plants and berries. It may not be in line with our ideals, and it certainly would be dangerous, but what good are ideals and traditions when you're dead?
You find enough plants to feed your people.
You find plants, but they're poisonous. Again.
You find plants, but not enough to keep the clan fed.
Success! Our foragers have found enough edible plants to feed our people. We can continue on!
Our elders will talk of this day for ages to come!
We found edible plants, or so we thought. Within a few hours, the clan's stomachs began grumbling for a different reason...
I hope we have enough latrines!
Our foragers have returned, saying they couldn't find anything edible.
As dangerous as the animals here can be, we have decided that hunting them is the only way to survive.
Our men have returned with carcasses over their shoulders and wide smiles on their faces. The hunt was a success! We have enough to feed our clan.

It was my decision to leave in the name of our traditions, and my people have suffered for my decision. As their leader, it is my duty to care for them and uphold our ways, so I have decided to lead the hunt
You find enough game to feed your people.
Lok'tar! We have bested this inhospitable land, and I lead the hunting party home with enough wildfowl to feed the whole of my people.
I have failed my people. I return home with nothing more than a wounded body and wounded pride. My people, though sad and disappointed, at least respect my attempt to provide for them.
My [Root.GetTitle]! Our scouts have returned, giving us two choices. Nearby is an area that could be settled, though going further south would give us access to the sea.
You move closer to the sea.

We decided to stay in the Black Morass for a while and look for allies. It might not be the wisest idea, since Gul'dan has been encouraging the other orcs to turn against us, but it's still worth the effort.
The other orcs are talking about Durotan spreading dissension among the Horde, hoping other clans will leave with him.
They are weak and not worth our time. Whatever they do, they cannot achieve anything.

It seems like no matter what we try, [From.GetFirstName]'s words weigh heavier than ours, and the other orcs view us as either fools or traitors. At the very least, my clan respects my attempts to get the other orcs to see things our way.
You decide to leave without the other clans.
Our words fall on deaf ears. The other orcs won't listen to anything we have to say. We'll just have to leave without them.
Deathwing, was one of the five Dragon Aspects. However, driven mad by the Old Gods, he turned against the other Aspects during the War of the Ancients.
Tales of your misdeeds are told from Winterspring to Stranglethorn.
Your low character is the subject of Tortollan stories.

column3: le Seigneur du Ciel et des Océans rugissants

column2: Lord Alexei Barov goes down in Warcraft history as a famous agent of the Scourge, and one of the death knights who took their post within the Scholomance. Before the plague, however, Alexei was the lord of Caer Darrow, a keep constructed in the middle of Darrowmere Lake in Lordaeron, and it is perhaps the oldest standing human monument on Azeroth. Dark magic is stirring, and Lord Alexei's mind has already been corrupted by the Cult of the Damned. Can Lord Barov be redeemed by the Light, or will he become one of million other victims of the Lich King's Scourge?

King Thoras Trollbane is the grand warrior-king of Stromgarde. Originally, he led Stromgarde to be one of the founding members of the Alliance of Lordaeron, but due to disagreement with King Terenas, Thoras Trollbane retracted Stromgarde's membership. These diagreements, however, did not stop Stromgarde from becoming a heroic contender in the Second War. Trollbane personally led his troops to cut off the Horde in Alterac, preventing them from overwhelming the Capital City of Lordaeron, though a good part of Stromgarde lay in ruin.

Father of Varian Wrynn and King of Stormwind and Azeroth during the Second War. A grand portion of his reign was addled by dooming prophecies from Medivh, the Guardian. He spoke of how the prosperity of Azeroth was soon at an end. With the rise of Blackhand as Warchief, the war against the Orcs has taken a desperate turn. Will Azeroth protect against the Horde of Black Morass, or shall it fall as Medivh predicted so long ago?
Your master slept too long. It's time to awaken him.
column3: Votre maître a dormi trop longtemps. Il est temps de le réveiller.

column2: §Y[This.GetBestName]§! is freed from the influence of the Lich King\n

A shadow councilor is appointed by the leader of the Shadow Council and can only be retired if the laws of the council have been completely abolished or if the ruler is NOT influenced by the leader of the Shadow Council.

A shadow councilor is appointed by the leader of the Shadow Council and can only be retired if the laws of the council have been completely abolished or if the ruler is NOT influenced by the leader of the Shadow Council.

A shadow councilor is appointed by the leader of the Shadow Council and can only be retired if the laws of the council have been completely abolished or if the ruler is NOT influenced by the leader of the Shadow Council.
This character suffers from pneumonia – a deadly infection of the lungs.
This character is left-handed. People who are left-handed tend to have a considerable advantage in combat.
All spawned troops of invaders like the Horde, Legion, Scourge, Black Empire and the Qiraji will be multiplied by 0.5.\n§RAffects player and AI.§!
All spawned troops of invaders like the Horde, Legion, Scourge, Black Empire and the Qiraji will be multiplied by 1.5.\n§RAffects player and AI.§!
All spawned troops of invaders like the Horde, Legion, Scourge, Black Empire and the Qiraji will be multiplied by 2.\n§RAffects player and AI.§!

When the world was still young, our glorious masters' dominion thrived in perpetual twilight until the intrusion of the Usurpers. That dominion was known as Shath'mag, the Black Empire. Now, our endless forces patiently await the inevitable day when a new Twilight Viceroy emerges to lead them to victory and bring forth the Hour of Twilight.
Enables §GStudy Magical Secrets§! in Intrigue Tab
Enables §GMark of Light§! on character portraits
Replaces §GMark of Light§! by §GMark of Elune§! on character portraits
Enables §GUse Poisonous Gas§! on character portraits
Enables §GUse Soul Shard§! on your portrait
Enables §GCreate Monstrous Undead§! on prisoner portraits
Enables §GSubdue Void Creature§! on your portrait

Your slightly eccentric liege has proclaimed a new law that is to be upheld throughout the realm. It reads:

"Whereas the children of the realm have become desensitised to violence, and: whereas the general populace seems to have lost all regard for the sanctity of life:

Therefore I, [From.GetTitledName], decree that all forms of violence directed at other reasonable beings be outlawed, including both capital and corporal punishment as well as the torture of criminals, heathens and foreigners. These vulnerable social groups are instead to be rehabilitated and eventually released back into society as productive citizens.

The new law has been written and couriers are even now distributing it to all of your vassals. You admire your handiwork:

"Whereas the children of the realm have become desensitised to violence, and: whereas the general populace seems to have lost all regard for the sanctity of life:

Therefore I, [From.GetTitledName], decree that all forms of violence directed at other reasonable beings be outlawed, including both capital and corporal punishment as well as the torture of criminals, heathens and foreigners. These vulnerable social groups are instead to be rehabilitated and eventually released back into society as productive citizens.
Scour the land for a [Root.GetRelAdjective] Woman to join my court and advise me on religious matters.
Scour the land for a [Root.GetRelAdjective] Man to join my court and advise me on religious matters.
A lot of orcs left beyond the Dark Portal. We need all the clans, if we want to gain a foothold in Azeroth.
The Old Gods have gave you their mercy, but you're still far from perfect. Only the most worthy are able to get the ideal form, the crown of evolution and adaptation to the cruel world.

It's time to stop this carnage. The Horde has conquered enough land to start a new life in Azeroth. Many orcs are returning to their families, burying their axes into the ground. They have vowed to forget the horrors of war that they have had to go through. The Warlords of the Horde still pose a threat to some parts of Azeroth, but the bloodiest wars are behind us.
Conquer border territory of aggressive neighbor... or of just neighbor if you're aggressive enough. Pirates, murlocs, naga, vrykul and evil religions can also take any coastal county.
Has gender equal religion or culture\n

The overthrow of the ruling elite led to the disruption of friendly relations with Horde's allies. The new rulers and clans are either unable or unwilling to support the alliances of the previous warchief. Their emissaries have been recalled and vast territories have been left without the Horde's military support.
The Master of the Horse delegates the actual day to day running of the actual stables, much of the prestige of this office comes from the responsibility for the stud.

column4: Dies ist Eure momentane §Y[Root.GetCurrency]§!
$OFFMAP|Y$\nInteraktion mit §Y$OFFMAP_SHORT§! öffnen.

column2: The Scourge can subjugate rulers and turn them undead if it's possible.

column4: [GetSocietyLeaderDesc]
[GetSocietyLeaderDesc]
[GetSocietyLeaderDesc]
[GetSocietyLeaderDesc]
[GetSocietyLeaderDesc]

column2: The high elves are very addicted to their well. We can use it against them to convert a province to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith.
Can §GBathe in Well Energy§! by right-clicking title shield of High Elven county to convert province religion
§Y[Root.GetBestName]§! should start thinking about marriage and heirs.
Does NOT serves Legion, Old Gods or Lich King\n
Followers of evil religions that serve the Legion, Old Gods or the Lich King can't change their religion.
Followers of evil religions that serve the Legion, Old Gods or the Lich King can change their religion only if they're kind enough.
Followers of dark religion that follow Fel, Void or Necromantic ways can't change their religion.
Only vanilla game restrictions are active.
column3: Seules les restrictions de base sont actives.

column2: I won't allow myself to lose this power!
This character suffers from Devouring Plague, a type of venereal disease.

For some time now, my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been avoiding me. [From.GetSheHeCap] has not visited my bedchamber for several weeks. When I have demanded to know why [From.GetSheHe] has given me nothing but feeble excuses. Today I overheard a couple of [From.GetHerHis] servants gossiping. They said [From.GetFirstName] has contracted Devouring Plague!
Repulsive sores and abscesses are spreading across your body. You have contracted Devouring Plague.
The sores on your body have vanished and you are almost back to your regular self. You are rid of Devouring Plague.
[From.GetTitledName] thinks you may be developing [Root.GetDiagnosis]. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
[From.GetTitledName] is fairly sure you are developing [Root.GetDiagnosis], although so far your condition is stable. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.

[From.GetTitledName] states that [From.GetHerHis] extensive medical experience leads [From.GetHerHim] to the certain conclusion that you are developing [Root.GetDiagnosis]. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
[From.GetTitledName] is sure you are developing [Root.GetDiagnosis]. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.
[From.GetTitledName] hesitantly suggests you are probably developing [Root.GetDiagnosis]. [From.GetSheHeCap] insists that you follow [From.GetHerHis] instructions.

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has not been quite [From.GetHerselfHimself] lately. For a while now, I have noticed [From.GetHerHim] looking tired and thin. I have just been informed of the cause - [From.GetFirstName] has contracted [Root.GetDiagnosis]!
You feel as if you are burning up and at times you have difficulties distinguishing between dreams and reality. You have contracted the Corrupted Blood.
[From.GetSheHeCap] has been struck by the §YCorrupted Blood§!
A very contagious disease that turns blood into thick bile. Rumors say that it has been created by a blood god, known as Hakkar.
Your delirium has lifted and your temperature is back to normal. You have beaten the Corrupted Blood.
This character suffers from Frost Fever, a disease that lowers the body's temperature.
You feel as if you are burning up, yet your body shivers as if you are freezing. You have contracted Frost Fever.
Your delirium has lifted and your temperature is back to normal. You have beaten Frost Fever.
Frost Fever is loose in this county.
This character suffers from Blood Plague. This disease affects the organs and causes internal bleeding.
Blood Plague is loose in this county.
You are thrown between waves of chills and sweats. Food has lost its appeal and no amount of sleep seems to remedy your fatigue. You have contracted Blood Plague.
You awake rejuvenated. After some moments of disbelief you realize that your fever has passed and your appetite has returned. You have survived Blood Plague.
This character suffers from Swamp Fever.
Swamp Fever is loose in this county.
Your mind is clouded and a dull red rash is spreading across your body. You feel hot and your joints ache. You have contracted Swamp Fever.
A vigor has returned to you as the aches from your recent disease leaves your body. You have survived Swamp Fever.
Invites character to be your religious head, [Root.GetRelHeadTitle]\n
Our realm is powerful enough to unite the scattered cults and religious communities of our people under one individual, the [Root.GetRelHeadTitle].

[From.GetBestName] announced the beginning of a new era. Under the auspices of a mighty empire, the [From.Religion.GetName] religion has united its faith under a single religious leader. The first [Root.GetTitle], [Root.GetFirstName], was chosen personally by [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Following the magnificent ceremony and the presentation of the divine regalia, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has sworn faithfully to serve the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName] and [From.Religion.GetHighGodName].
The speed at which claims are fabricated by means of using the 'Fabricate Claims' job action is unchanged.
The speed at which claims are fabricated by means of using the 'Fabricate Claims' job action is increased by a factor of one and a quarter.\n§GThis is the recommended rule.§!
The speed at which claims are fabricated by means of using the 'Fabricate Claims' job action is reduced by a factor of one and a quarter.
The speed at which claims are fabricated by means of using the 'Fabricate Claims' job action is increased by a factor of one and a half.
The speed at which claims are fabricated by means of using the 'Fabricate Claims' job action is reduced by a factor of one and a half.
The speed at which claims are fabricated by means of using the 'Fabricate Claims' job action is increased by a factor of two.
The speed at which claims are fabricated by means of using the 'Fabricate Claims' job action is reduced by a factor of two.
§YPowerful Vassals§! cannot be fired from the §YCouncil§!\nCan no longer change succession if §YElective Monarchy§! is instituted
column3: Les §Yvassaux puissants§! ne peuvent pas être révoqués du §YConseil§!\nLa loi de succession ne peut plus être changée si la §Ymonarchie élective§! est instaurée
column4: §YMächtige Vasallen§! können nicht vom §YRat§! ausgeschlossen werden.\nDie Nachfolge kann nicht geändert werden, wenn §YWahlmonarchie§! etabliert ist.
column6: §YVasallo poderoso§! no puede ser despedido del §YConsejo§!\nNo se puede volver a cambiar la sucesión si se instituye §YMonarquia Electiva§!.

column2: §YPowerful Vassals§! can be fired from the §YCouncil§!\nCan now change succession if §YElective Monarchy§! is instituted
column3: Les §Yvassaux puissants§! peuvent être révoqués du §YConseil§!\nLa loi de succession peut désormais être changée si la §Ymonarchie élective§! est instaurée
column4: §YMächtige Vasallen§! können vom §YRat§! ausgeschlossen werden.\nDie Nachfolge kann geändert werden, wenn §YWahlmonarchie§! etabliert ist.
column6: §YVasallos poderosos§! puede ser despedido del §YConsejo§!\nAhora puede cambiar la sucesión si se instituye §YMonarquía Electiva§!.

column2: You cannot hold infinite amounts of land yourself. To expand, you will need to rely on vassal rulers. Keep them happy with titles and gifts lest they decide to revolt! The game will end in 900, if your line can stay in power that long...
column3: Vous ne pouvez pas détenir un nombre illimité de terres, il faudra donc composer avec des vassaux. Contentez-les à l'aide de titres et de cadeaux pour éviter une révolte ! La partie se terminera en 900, si votre lignée réussit à rester au pouvoir aussi longtemps...
column4: Ihr alleine könnt nicht unendlich viel Land selbst kontrollieren und müsst deshalb auf Eure Vasallen setzen. Titel und Geschenke sorgen dafür, dass diese zufrieden sind. Das Spiel endet im Jahre 900, vorausgesetzt, Eure Familie kann sich so lange halten ...
column6: No puedes mantener cantidades infinitas de tierra. Para expandirte, tendrás que confiar en los gobernantes vasallos. ¡Mantenerlos contentos con títulos y regalos hará que estén menos dispuestos a rebelarse! El juego termina en 900, si tu línea puede permanecer tanto tiempo en el poder...

column2: After an unsuccessful attempt at independence, most the Frostwolf clan has returned to the Horde. However, there are still some remnants that refuse to go back, choosing to wander Azeroth over suffering such an indignity.

Aggressive rulers are allowed to subjugate other rulers of the same religion group once in their lifetime. (With the 'Become $KING$' ambition, there is no such time limit against those who control titles within the kingdom.) Free men are always willing to follow the mightiest ruler...
Plant a massive tree connected to the Emerald Dream. These trees look mighty, but they're very vulnerable to an enemy.
§GWorld Tree§! and §GHolding Slots§! will be added in 3 years\n

In the past few months, it has been difficult not to notice the gigantic branches of the world tree stretching towards the sky and across the horizon. The precious seed planted in [target_province.GetName] has, after several long months, grown to enormous proportions. Its mighty crown shelters several peaceful settlements that hug its trunk and roots that of which create large ripples and hills in the surrounding earth. The nascent world tree looks nigh indestructible, but that is far from the truth. The great tree requires protection from those who would dare threaten it, and the duty falls upon those willing to defend the ideals of life itself.
Ha! These heretics pray to the big tree!
Meh... nothing special, only one little spark and...
A massive tree connected to the Emerald Dream. The world trees are very important for druids. They attract pilgrims from around the world under their mighty crowns.
Has no other world tree within realm\n
The planted seed of the world tree in [target_province.GetName] couldn't germinate. The sprout withered and died.
Use the power of the Old Gods to taint the world tree.

The lingering presence of the Old Gods in [target_province.GetName] has left an irreparable scar. Life has departed the surrounding groves, and the dark magic of the Emerald Nightmare has come to take its place. The mighty tree has thrown off its foliage, leaving only mutilated black branches behind. Bloodied forests sprout at the trunk and roots of the great tree filled with monsters and altars erected in the name of the Old Gods. Deathly silence lies still over the grove, occasionally disrupted by the soft whispers of the dark ones below. This place has been lost to corruption, and now only fire can truly cleanse this scar from the earth.
How did we let this happen?
It's better to stay away from those places.
This massive tree was once a magnificent world tree, but now it has become utterly tainted by the Emerald Nightmare, a sick and twisted Old God manifestation of the Emerald Dream.
There's a growing or existing world tree in one of the temples of this province.
Burn the world tree. This will enrage druidic and shamanic followers.
This character has burned a world tree. This is a terrible crime against many creatures of Azeroth.

Even at night, the brightest floods of light fill the woods of [target_province.GetName]. The fire of a burning world tree fills the sky like the sun, rising far over the horizon of the highest peaks. Buildings constructed under the roots of the tree have collapsed like a house of flimsy cards under the weight of falling branches. The fire has consumed the tree, nearby settlements, and the nearby forests. There are no words in your tongue that can describe the stench and horror of the destruction wrought by this arson.

Even at night, the brightest floods of light fill the woods of [target_province.GetName]. The fire of a burning nightmarish tree fills the sky like the sun, rising far over the horizon of the highest peaks. Complexes constructed under the roots of the tree have collapsed like a house of flimsy cards under the weight of falling branches. The fire has consumed the tree, surrounding camps, and the nearby corrupted forestry. While its corruption and rot finally burn, there are no words in your tongue that can describe the stench and horror of the destruction wrought by this arson.

Your army has reached the nightmarish tree located in [target_province.GetName]. Its size is astounding, and its rottings branches spread out for several kilometers. Through its roots, the poisoned tree spreads its corruption further throughout the surrounding lands. If this place must be cleared, we must set fire to the tree and render it dust.

Your army has reached the great tree located in [target_province.GetName]. Its size is astounding, and its glorious branches spread out for several kilometers. Through its roots, the great tree spreads its life giving energies throughout the surrounding lands. If this place is to be purged, we must set fire to the tree and render it dust.
The fire will clear this place!
Unique building does NOT block it\n

Next to the temple called [target_title.GetName], you dug a hole and planted the sacred seed. So far this is only a defenseless sprout. You leave the grove with the hope that it will stand the test of time.

After the fall of Nordrassil, the night elves lost their immortality. The blessing from the Aspect of Time, the bronze dragon Nozdormu, has disappeared, confronting the elves with the hardships of mortal life. Outbreaks of disease took many elven lives, mostly children and old people, who remembered the times of the War of the Ancients. All that remains for the elves is to adapt to the harsh conditions of their new mortality.
This is a huge loss for the elves.
column3: C'est une immense perte pour les elfes...
Les elfes de la nuit perdent leur §Yimmortalité§!\n

column2: In the far reaches of the west, a falling star has crashed upon the relatively peaceful island of Azuremyst. Several pieces and chunks of crystal from the celestial body have scattered across the island chain, contaminating the local ecosystem. We have learned that this crashed object is no simple meteoric rock, but rather a dimensional ship carrying a host of humanoids departed from the shattered world of Draenor, the birthplace of the Horde. These people call themselves the Draenei, a race of Light-wielding priests, mages, and artificers descended from the same race of Eredar that threatened Azeroth not so long ago. They have crash landed here on Azeroth in an attempt to escape the Legion's onslaught with the help of a being seemingly made of pure Light, O'ros. Even now, the Draenei work to craft a new home for themselves here on Azeroth, centered around the crashed dimensional ship, to which they refer to as the Exodar.
They can run, but they can not hide!
As if we hadn't enough trouble with those curs back on Draenor.
This is an unexpected turn of events.

Having left the eastern kingdoms during the turmoil, the human settlers of Theramore have been quick to adapt to their new home on the continent of Kalimdor. The intermingling of various human cultures in the young kingdom has led to the formation of a new united identity for those who were simply pioneers and refugees before. Now more than ever, Theramore continues to develop into a legitimate human fiefdom not unlike the Seven Kingdoms of old.
column3: Après avoir quitté les Royaumes de l'Est, fuyant le chaos, les colons humains de Theramore se sont rapidement adaptés à leur nouvelle patrie sur Kalimdor. Le mélange multi-culturel au sein du jeune royaume a conduit à la formation d'une nouvelle identité pour ceux qui étaient auparavant pionniers et réfugiés. Maintenant plus que jamais, Theramore se développe continuellement pour devenir un vrai fief humain, semblable aux Sept Royaumes de l’ancien Monde.

column2: Theramore is here to stay. Or is it?
column3: Theramore est faite pour durer ! Enfin, espérons.

column2: The Orcish settlement of Kalimdor has brought all the Orcish clans of the Horde together within the nation known as Durotar. For many years, the members of these clans have coexisted with each other in an united effort to develop their new homeland in Kalimdor. As a result, the Orcish people have risen beyond the old divisions brought wrought by tribal clan hierarchies and customs and have bonded together to form a new identity for all of Orc-kind on Azeroth.

Not many humans would dare to venture into such dangerous corner of the world as the Southern Kalimdor. Those who did found their daily lives a constant struggle to survive. However, after years of living in these dangerous lands, they managed to adapt and prosper, usually by resorting to shady practices. The commonality they shared became much more than one of necessity. These humans became known as the Wastewanders, the menace of the southern sands.
We'll see what comes out of this.

After the discovery of Kalimdor by the humans, many of them settled around the eastern coasts of the western continent. But there's also a group of those who were searching for a new home deep in the wild frontiers of a strange new land, slowly fostering an identity of their own as they look to the future away from the human kingdoms of old.
The Empire of Zul is Reborn

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has done the unthinkable. Pursuing the mighty heritage of an ancient civilization, [From.GetSheHe] subjugated the five Troll empires of Azeroth and proclaimed [From.GetHerselfHimself] the supreme Emperor of Trollkind. Thousands of trolls rush to the streets of their major cities to celebrate the long awaited restoration of the ancient Empire of Zul.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] a réalisé l'impossible. Poursuivant le puissant héritage d'une très vieille civilisation, [From.GetSheHe] soumit les cinq empires trolls d'Azeroth et se proclama [From.GetHerselfHimself]-même Empereur-Suprême de tout les trolls. Des milliers de trolls se précipitent dans les rues de leurs grandes villes pour célébrer la restauration tant attendue de l'antique Empire de Zul.

column2: Tis be a glorious day, bruddas!
column3: C'est un jour glorieux, mes frères !

column2: The Empire of Zul was the progenitor of the five troll empires of contemporary era. Many trolls look fondly to the times of their supremacy, and perhaps one day a great leader will make the grandeur of the united Troll empire shine upon Azeroth once more.
column3: L'Empire de Zul fut l'ancêtre des empires trolls de notre époque. De nombreux trolls sont encore profondément nostalgiques de l'époque de leur suprématie, mais peut-être qu'un jour un grand souverain fera revivre la splendeur de cet empire, et de tout les trolls sur Azeroth.

column2: Has chance to receive §GVoid Inflow§! by getting §YVoid Corruption§!
Has chance to receive §GFel Inflow§! by getting §YFel Corruption§!
Has chance to get §GExtra Soul Shard§!

The [target_wonder.GetName] has become a center for dark mages and occultism, and some unholy beings have decided to settle close to the [target_wonder.GetWonderAdj] construction. The latest reports mention tents and sacrificial altars — they are obviously putting down deep roots.
Kill them and take their possessions!

Observing the movements of the stars at night, you have begun to see some regular patterns. These observations, however, have raised many new questions. You are starting to wonder, for example, why are there two moons?

One morning, your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to see you. [From.GetSheHeCap] says: 'I am worried. I have heard that you are spending late nights studying the sky and entertaining heretical notions about the Great Dark. I would ask that you stop, for your own sake.'
You nightly studies of the movements of the celestial bodies are increasing your knowledge of a great many things. You feel that you are getting closer to understanding the Great Dark Beyond.

You studies of the celestial spheres are progressing well. You see movements and relationships that you had never dared guess at. It seems clear to you now that the laws that guide the movements of the stars must also be reflected on Azeroth in some way...
You are sure you have made a breakthrough in your studies. Yes, it cannot be otherwise. The core of Azeroth is constantly in motion as if it is alive. How little we know of this planet!

One morning, your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] comes to see you. [From.GetSheHeCap] says: 'I am worried. I have heard that you are spending late nights staring at the sky, speaking in odd riddles and entertaining heretical notions about the Great Dark. I would ask that you stop, for your own sake.'

The studies you have conducted in your observatory have convinced you that there are many strange things beyond the Great Dark. There are few sources and no one to share knowledge with you, however. But you have heard of a strange troll witch in the Great Sea who is rumored to possess vast knowledge of the weird.
I will go and see her.

You arrive at the abode of the strange troll witch. After some persuasion, she invites you in. You speak at length, and she tells of you of the Runemaster Molgeim, who knew many things of the strange spheres beyond and of talking beings as old as the universe itself. You find out that Molgeim wrote a book called Shath'mag, in which he recorded many strange and unholy truths. The witch says that as she is impressed by your sincerity and desire for knowledge, she can sell you a copy of the book. She tells you to beware, however, as too much intense study of Shath'mag is said to drive the reader insane...

Shortly after the death of your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], you are brought a strange piece of news. It seems that [From.GetHerHis] library was raided, the only item stolen being a strange old book of unknown origin. Two servants who were in the library at the time were found dead, though witnesses refused to describe the state of the bodies.

The book you bought from the strange troll witch has proven quite useful for gaining new ideas and insights in your studies of the stars and what lies beyond. It does, however, contain some quite disturbing texts and images, things that lead towards a level of understanding that might make one... mad.
Holy War' CB is available only for characters with 'Zealous' trait and aggressive religions like the Scarlet Light and Shath'yar.
column3: Les guerres saintes ne sont activées que pour pour les personnage ayant le trait 'Zélé' et une religion belliqueuse comme la Lumière écarlate et les Shat'yar.

column2: Holy War' CB is available for all.
column3: Les guerres saintes sont activées pour tous.

column2: This character has done research of the Great Dark Beyond.
Kolk was one of the first centaur, directly descended from the union of Therazane and Zaetar. He was the First Khan as well as progenitor of the Kolkar.
Waylon was an admiral of Kul Tiras, who led the Stormsong tidesages into the northern valley and drove away the quilboar, as well as established the Shrine of the Storm.
Maraudos was the fourth Khan of the centaur, as well as the founder of the Maraudine clan, the protectors of the centaur holy ground of Maraudon.
Madoran was the first Bronzebeard king, victor of the Ironforge civil war and later leader of the coalition against the Dark Iron clan in the War of the Three Hammers.
Khardros was the High Thane of the Wildhammer dwarves, who led them in the War of the Three Hammers. Founder of Grim Batol and Aerie Peak.
Sorcerer-Thane Thaurissan was the leader of the Dark Iron dwarves during the War of the Three Hammers. Summoner of Ragnaros, the Firelord.
Barathen had managed to win a significant victory for the humans during the Gnoll War, cementing Stormwind's position as a regional power for decades.
The God-King of the Zandalari, responsible for reviving an ancient idea of Troll unity dating back to the times of the Empire of Zul in the form of conclaves in Zuldazar.
Lowered Learning requirement for §GLoa Priest Training§!
A founding father of the Alliance of Lordaeron, King Terenas was responsible for uniting the feuding human kingdoms against a common threat, the Orcish Horde.
A legendary warlord and a sworn enemy of the high elves, Zul'jin had led the Amani trolls in a brutal campaign against Quel'Thalas during the Second War.
A powerful Priestess of the Moon, Tyrande was one of the leaders of the Kaldorei resistance forces against the Legion during the War of the Ancients.
A prodigy in the art of Druidism, Malfurion was one of the leaders of the Kaldorei resistance forces against the Legion during the War of the Ancients.
Known as the Destroyer, Blackhand led the Orcish Horde to Azeroth through the Dark Portal in pursuit of new lands to conquer.
One of the few orcs who refused the Blood Pact, Durotan left the Horde after crossing the Dark Portal to uphold ancestral traditions and settled in remote lands with his clan.
The redeemer of the orcs, Grommash earned the title by slaying Mannoroth the Pit Lord, bringing an end to the Blood Pact between the annihilan and the orcish race.
Once chief among Queen Azshara's handmaidens before the Sundering, later a powerful sea witch matron of the Coilfang tribe held in high regard by various Naga.
Uther the Lightbringer was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by Alonsus Faol himself.
Tirion Fordring was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by Alonsus Faol himself.
Saidan Dathrohan was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by Alonsus Faol himself.
Gavinrad the Dire was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by Sir Anduin Lothar.
Turalyon was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by Alonsus Faol himself.
Dath'Remar Sunstrider was the founder of Quel'Thalas, who led the Highborne exiles from Kalimdor into their new homeland, becoming one of the first high elves.
Lireesa Windrunner was the Ranger-General of Silvermoon and a staunch protector of Quel'Thalas against the aggression of the Amani and the Horde.
The chosen champion of the Old Gods, [This.GetFirstNameWithNick] had restored the eldritch Black Empire and became the herald of the Hour of Twilight.
Increased §GInsanity§! gain from sieges and sacrifices
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] was the commander who led the Siege of Ahn'qiraj and personally vanquished the Old God, C'Thun in the depths of the Qiraji temple city.
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by the Archbishop himself.
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by the Archbishop himself.
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by the Archbishop himself.
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins, appointed by the Archbishop himself.
[This.GetFirstNameWithNick] was one of the founding members of the Order of the Silver Hand, a knightly order of paladins.
Ignaeus was a general of Strom, whose legendary prowess in battle against the Amani trolls earned him fearsome reputation as the Trollbane.
A fearsome warlord, King Ymiron had led the Dragonflayer to victory against the Jalgar, securing his position as an undisputed sovereign of the northern Vrykul.
As founder of the first Alliance, [This.GetFirstNameWithNick] was responsible for uniting the feuding kingdoms against a common threat, the Orcish Horde.
Having accomplished the purification of the dark crystal, [This.GetFirstNameWithNick] became the first wielder of the eponymous weapon.
column4: Nachdem die Reinigung des dunklen Kristalls abgeschlossen war, wurde [This.GetFirstNameWithNick] zum ersten Träger der namensgebenden Waffe.

column2: Recently, the harmful influence of death magic has changed something in you. You feel its presence in every vein, at every fingertip. It changes you irrevocably, perverting your mind and revealing its darkest corners.
column4: In letzter Zeit hat der schädliche Einfluss der Todesmagie etwas in Euch verändert. Ihr spürt ihre Präsenz in jeder Ader, mit jeder Fingerspitze. Sie verändert Euch unwiderruflich, indem sie Euren Geist verdreht und seine dunkelsten Ecken offenbart.

column2: Your past gods turned their back on you after you were stricken by the curse of undeath. By numbing your ability to feel joy of existence and amplifying your negative emotions, it slowly takes its toll on your very being.
column4: Eure früheren Götter wandten sich von Euch ab, nachdem Ihr vom Fluch des Untodes heimgesucht wurdet. Indem Ihr Eure Fähigkeit, Lebensfreude zu empfinden, betäubt und eure negativen Emotionen verstärkt, fordert es langsam seinen Tribut von Eurem Dasein.

column2: I shall bear this burden, but I will not forsake my freedom.
column4: Ich werde diese Last tragen, aber ich werde meine Freiheit nicht aufgeben.

column2: It is a price I am willing to pay to bask in the power of the Lich King.
column4: Es ist ein Preis, den ich bereit bin zu zahlen, um mich in der Macht des Lichkönigs zu sonnen.

column2: I shall bind my soul to the Blighted Lands, so I can draw my power from there.
column4: Ich werde meine Seele an die verwüsteten Lande binden, damit ich meine Kraft von dort beziehen kann.
Ich werde [Root.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] nicht verraten!
Blut von [This.GetFirstNameWithNick]

column2: The restorer of an ancient legacy, [This.GetFirstNameWithNick] gained recognition among the Trolls as one of their greatest champions and supreme ruler.
column4: Der Erneuerer eines alten Erbes,[This.GetFirstNameWithNick], erlangte bei den Trollen Anerkennung als einer ihrer größten Champions und obersten Herrscher.
Geringerer Lernbedarf für die §GNekromantenausbildung§!
Erhöhter §YWahnsinn§!-Gewinn

column2: We cannot join our vassals' wars (except for Crusades and for supporting their claims outside your realm)
column4: Wir können uns nicht den Kriegen unserer Vasallen anschließen (außer den Kreuzzügen und der Unterstützung ihrer Ansprüche außerhalb Eures Reiches).
Ner'zhul

column2: An old weather-bitten diplomat who has served in the courts of the great rulers agreed to take you under his wing for a few days. He has taught you many valuable tricks in how to deal with vassals and other rulers.
column4: Ein alter wettergegerbter Diplomat, der an den Höfen der großen Herrscher gedient hat, hat zugestimmt, Euch für ein paar Tage unter seine Fittiche zu nehmen. Er hat Euch viele wertvolle Tricks beigebracht, wie man mit Vasallen und anderen Herrschern umgeht.

Weise
Das ist ein guter Preis.

column2: The house of the Gods, an Step Pyramid is the holy place where messengers can be sent to them.
column4: Das Haus der Götter, eine Stufenpyramide ist der heilige Ort, an dem Boten zu ihnen geschickt werden können.

Inseln von Kalimdor

column2: This is the succession type in the great naval Merchant Republics. The next leader is determined from among the heads of the five grand Patrician families depending on Age, Prestige, and invested Campaign Funds. Elections are held every 12 years.
column4: Dies ist die Nachfolgeart in den großen Marine-Handelsrepubliken. Der nächste Anführer wird aus den Köpfen der fünf großen Patrizierfamilien je nach Alter, Prestige und investiertem Kampagnenkapital bestimmt. Die Wahlen finden alle 12 Jahre statt.

column2: Respect is a value based on the Age and Prestige of a Patrician, determining how likely he is to be elected Doge. It can be increased by investing money in the Campaign Fund, but children can never be elected.
column4: Respekt ist ein Wert, der auf dem Alter und dem Prestige eines Patriziers basiert und bestimmt, wie wahrscheinlich es ist, dass er zum $RULER_TITLE$ gewählt wird. Sie kann durch Investitionen in den Kampagnenfonds erhöht werden, aber Kinder können nie gewählt werden.

column2: Money in the Campaign Fund will increase your Respect in the senate and make your candidate more likely to be elected the next $RULER_TITLE$. You can freely adjust the amount until the current $RULER_TITLE$ dies, when the Fund will be used up in the election campaign.
column4: Geld im Kampagnenfonds erhöht Euren Respekt im Senat und erhöht die Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass Ihr Kandidat zum nächsten $RULER_TITLE$ gewählt wird. Ihr könnt den Betrag frei anpassen, bis der aktuelle $RULER_TITLE$ stirbt. Dann wird der Fonds im Wahlkampf aufgebraucht.
Staatsbankier

column2: The State Banker is responsible for managing the state bank and finance.
column4: Der Staatsbankier ist für die Verwaltung der Staatsbank und der Finanzen verantwortlich.

column2: [target_new_doge.GetDynName] has been elected the new [target_new_doge.GetTitle] of the Great Republic of [target_republic.GetBaseName].
column4: [target_new_doge.GetDynName] wurde zum neuen [target_new_doge.GetTitle] der großen Republik [target_republic.GetBaseName] gewählt.

column2: Our duodecennial held elections are coming up a year from now, and this will be your last chance to influence the outcome in your favour.
column4: Unsere zwölfjährlichen Wahlen stehen in einem Jahr bevor, und dies wird Eure letzte Chance sein, das Ergebnis zu Euren Gunsten zu beeinflussen.
Genug! Wir kehren nach Hause zurück.
Gepriesen sei [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]!

column2: A union of many kingdoms and tribes. The power of the supreme leader is severely limited in order to provide a guarantee of self-government to the rulers within the political faction.
column3: Une faction politique unifie de nombreux royaumes et de nombreuses tribus. Le pouvoir du chef suprême est sévèrement limité afin de fournir aux dirigeants de la faction une garantie d'autonomie.
column4: Eine Vereinigung vieler Königreiche und Stämme. Die Macht des obersten Führers ist stark eingeschränkt, um den Herrschern innerhalb der politischen Fraktion eine Garantie der Selbstverwaltung zu geben.
